content: crochet a pretty flower square for your next afghan project this 12-inch block is part of the moogly 2022 afghan cal **this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience ** **difficulty ** intermediate **materials needed ** 180-190 yards red heart with love in white or red heart ombré in sea coral color of your choice 6mm hook or hook needed to meet gauge yarn needle scissors stitch markers optional **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet bphdc = back post half_double_crochet 2dc cluster = decrease in same st **additional terms ** *half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop* = look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back and you should see another v you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop *psc* = picot single_crochet instructions insert hook yo draw up a loop draw through 1 loop 3 times making a chain-3 yo draw through both loops on hook pull your chain-3 space towards the front of your work instead of pushing it toward the back *picot single_crochet chain stitch* = psc chain st insert hook through center of popcorn yo draw up a loop draw through 1 loop 3 times making a chain-3 yo draw through both loops on hook ***this is crocheted identically to the psc described above but due to its positioning in the round the chain will not create a little picot it will lie flat *** *popcorn* = popcorn instructions work 5 double_crochet in same st take hook out of last double_crochet just worked and put it through top of first double_crochet grab loop from 5th double_crochet and pull it through the first double_crochet *single_crochet spike st* = with working yarn on hook insert hook through designated st yo and draw up a loop to height of active round pull working yarn through both loops *back bar of single_crochet* instructions look at the back of the stitch and locate the short bar that runs horizontal work all stitches for that section into this bar *center single_crochet* = known as the waistcoat stitch work a regular single_crochet by inserting your hook in the center of the post between the 2 vertical lines that the loop you draw up makes complete as you would a regular single_crochet st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces prev = previous **gauge ** piece should measure almost 5 across after round 6 **measurements ** 12 x 12 after blocking **additional notes ** -chain-1 at beginning of round does not count as a stitch -psc stitches should not have the picot pushed to the back it should pop out the front -relaxed gauge is required for the center single_crochet stitches to lay flat tight gauge will make the piece
